He did not know what method to use to escape from his past mistakes.
He said, In the past, I was born due to my tongue and gave rise to slander.
Now I will cut off my tongue to atone for this offense.
His elder brother said, Even if you cut off a thousand tongues, you still cannot extinguish this offense.
If you want to extinguish this offense, you should use other skillful means.
The Dharma teacher then requested his elder brother to explain the skillful means for extinguishing offenses.
His elder brother said, Your tongue is good at slandering the Mahayana.
If you want to extinguish this offense, you should skillfully explain the Mahayana.
